text: I had steak and eggs x-mas night,  service was ok,  . I ask for my hashbrowns to be well done, they wore barly cooked, and the steak was like shoe leather, a strip of dry tough meat, cost over $16    not going back. I could of gotten the same meal at Denny's for less,

The service was terrible for lunch in Sunday! Waitress literally threw our poached egg on the table without a word & walked away!!! Charged us for orange juice we never received! Didn't return to see if everything was all right. So couldn't remind her of juice!!! The food was not tasty! The coldslaw had absolutely no flavor!!! You have to ask for refills of coffee or water!  Food was cold so it was just sitting before being served!!

After playing a couple of hours of Pai-Gow Poker at  The Orleans, I asked for a comped lunch at the Courtyard Cafe.  I've heard some good things about the place, and you can't beat a free meal.  Wrong!  The place was only about 2/3 full and the service was slower than the over 100 category in the senior olympics.  I ordered the fish and chips.  The only good thing was the french fries.  The meal is supposed to come with 3 pieces of fish.  I got 2 1/2.  The first piece was O.K.  The second was 1/2 the size and seemed thrown in just to be 3 pieces.  The last piece was rock hard and must have been from some diseased fish.  Lucky me, I got the fish with cancer or a tumor.  Too grossed-out for dessert, I left and will NOT be coming back to this dump.
I guess it worked for us at 3 am in a drunken haze. Not to mention still part of our comp pkg at the orleans. Decent early morning breakfast the day we left as well.

I have been in this hotel for almost a month for training for a new job so I decided to go try their food after the disappointment of the buffet in the hotel. I would of given them more stars based on the food but last night I tried the open face roast beef and mashed potatoes and discovered a green tint to the beef so I tasted it and it tasted spoiled so I got the greeter and he was oh yah I see it well I'm not sure because it's a process I said well I don't know either but green meat usually is a sign that the meat is bad he was well do you want something else so I decided to get the turkey open faced meal because I had it before and it was good and was very plentiful on the turkey well this time it was skimpy and dry and hardly any gravy I was almost afraid to eat it really so I paid for a meal I didn't want and the service I got all 3 times I ate there was horrible if you are just one person they tend to ignore you and give you no service.
Been 6 years since I've been here so it was like a fresh experience. Nothing super special... Good portion for normal people, good dessert. No coke here, only Pepsi... Be warned. Nice staff.
have to ask for refills and waitress just stands around after taking your order everyone walks around with an attitude and its depressing and horrible service.  this will be the last time I come here

This is my top three places to go eat in Vegas. Awesome and very inexpensive prime rib, and canjun fries!!! The food is as good as any good diners in the city at a fractional of the price. There was no wait either.

So we decided to check out the relatively new The Orleans resort and see what was for dinner. we made a pretty good choice by picking courtyard. the place was clean, nice, friendly staff. prices were pretty low cause we came during christmas and they had a lot of specials PLUS the waitress GOT JOKES!! 

i ordered the christmas special: honeybaked ham w/cranberry sauce, salad, soup, steamed veggies, mashed potatoes all for $13!! they also had other specials for the same price with turkey and salmon. you CANT beat that price fo sho. the ham came out perfect and everything on my plate could not be better. the only complaints were that other people that ordered the  t-bone and meat loaf said it was a little too dry. And you cant go wrong with gumbo from a resort called THE ORLEANS!

Ugh. This place...not good. We usually end up coming here for breakfast at least once when staying at The Orleans for Viva Las Vegas. Why do we continue to go then you may ask? We go because it serves breakfast all day (the buffet is better, but  breakfast ends quite early)  and is convenient, and cheap which works when you have a hang over and you're short on time. There is so much going on at once, so  it's not always easy to go elsewhere off site, that and/or the thought of getting in the shuttle bus to the strip is more than your pounding head can stand. Unfortunately, The Orleans is full of pretty bad food choices generally speaking.

The food is mediocre - the toast comes covered in this spray butter crap which makes it limp and damp - who knows what's in that shit. Even when you request dry toast they put it on. You have to request REAL cream for your coffee, or you get this cream replacement that is probably made from some sort of nasty oil product and coloured white. Not to mention it's been sitting on the table for who knows how long. GROSS! The food is inconsistently prepared -  you can ask for eggs over easy, and they can arrive medium, overcooked, or under cooked...you just never know. I can't speak about how the rest of the food is, as we don't go there for anything other than breakfast..

The service is pretty crap too. I ordered a Mimosa when I placed my food order, and waited 20 minutes for it. I tried to ask about it, but the servers here have the art of not making eye contact with customers down pretty good. There are a bunch of servers running back and forth, but they don't often seem to be carrying anything. Our server disappeared completely for awhile, and I couldn't get anyone else's attention.  By the time I got her, I told her that if my Mimosa wasn't coming right now, to just cancel it. She said it was and said something about having to go to the bar to get it (What?) We got our food, and a few minutes later, I got it. Bloody hell, seriously?! I had intended to have one before I started eating, and then probably get another along with my breakfast. I'd probably stuck there until it was time for lunch if I'd ordered a second one! Over all, this place seems really disorganized. Yes, the place is busy, but holy hell people, not only is it Easter long weekend, but there are probably at least 1000 people in the hotel specifically for the Viva Las Vegas weekender! That's not new info to the hotel or staff as it's been going on at this location for quite some time now.  This last visit on the weekend was the worst I've experienced here yet, so hopefully it improves next year.

We haven't had dinner at the Courtyard Café at the Orleans since the Boyd Group took over a few years ago. We used to visit regularly as the food was fresh and tasty. 

Well, that was then. We had dinner there tonight after a movie and couldn't believe the drop in quality of everything from the food to the service.  I had the chicken fajita salad and my friend had the Kung Pao Chinese dinner.  The chicken was so salty I could feel my blood pressure rising with each bite I took. I could identify the salad and tomatoes, but the grilled stuff that they mixed into it was unidentifiable. I believe it was supposed to be green pepper and onions. It just looked like mush.

My friend's Kung Pao dinner had "salty" chicken also. It actually looked similar to what I was served. It just lacked the lettuce, tomato, and bits of corn.  Mine was a hodgepodge of food thrown together. Both dinners were disgusting as the food looked more than 1 day old and soggy.

There was a guy at the table next to us who had ordered the $6.99 spaghetti plate. As we were leaving, we saw the waiter pick up the bowl of almost untouched spaghetti when he left.  Just hope they weren't planning on just touching it up and serving it again because that's what our food looked like.  

The food was tired and so was the waitress. She looked haggard and could barely get the food on the table let alone drag herself back to refill our water glasses (which never happened).  

There are too, too many other great restaurants in Las Vegas.  For these 2 bad meals with just water to drink, the cost was $30.00.  Costly bad food!  You can bet that won't happen again!  Goodbye Orleans!

Service was mediocre at best. The food was below average. I suppose if you've been out drinking all night and had a case of the munchies then food quality wouldn't be an issue. However, if you're sober and care then lower expectations immensely.

Terrible service. Waitress gave me major attitude. I asked "excuse me may I please have a straw" she then raised her voice and replied "what you never bring your own straw from home" need major improvement in customer service. Unless this b*tch was prejudice. Never recommend this place to anyone. RUDE! RUDE! RUDE! NO CLASS OR ANY CUSTOMER SERVICE.

This place is only good for graveyard specials. I love coming here for the steak & eggs for $4.49 after midnight. I also order a side of sautéed mushrooms. Even on regular hours (24-hour special) they serve double cheeseburgers and fries for $4.49. Ask for Cajun fries & if you want to make it worth it. Get Swiss cheese & sautéed mushrooms to make a Swiss burger :) make sure you know what your ordering right away cause the server seem to be rushing you on your way.  Good savings and more than enough to get you full.

SO and i are still ticked that the gold coast graveyard breakfast specials are no more ( not quite no more just not as good ! )  SO had a $25 food credit so let's try our next graveyard spot ...live so close to orleans yet never tried the coffee shop ....
$1.95 biscuits and gravy ( my sis will like that ! ) $2.95 for the standard eggs/bacon/potatoes/toast ...it hits the spot for what it is ...let's face it ...at 3 in the morning most people eating there are so wasted you can fry up ground cardboard and they'll eat it.

Very unsatisfied with the FOOD. Service was great, but our steak and double cheeseburger were burnt - not to mention the fries were just dabbed with seasoning in the middle and not spread out, COLD TOO. I used to enjoy coming to their café for their graveyard specials, but now it seems the cook is different. I don't really recommend coming for a quick bite to eat there.

We eat at the Courtyard Café very often and have never had anything but excellent meals. Service is generally very good although there have been a few occasions when its very busy its hard to get a coffee refill. My favorites are the hot roast beef sandwich and the French toast. My wife is partial to their flatbread pizzas and fantastic salads. Food is reasonably priced for Las Vegas nowadays and the portions are generous.

Made a stop here because there was no parking available at the Blind Pig. Had a short dinner break before having to head back to a WSOP tournament. Bummed that they wouldn't let me pay extra to upgrade the soup that was included with the Land and Sea special to the Gumbo. Told me that I had to pay full price for it. Not very customer service friendly. Wasn't too crowded considering it was prime dinner time.

If I had known Fuddruckers was open 24 hours, I would have eaten there instead of here. Oh well. 

We got to Vegas around 1:30 AM and we're starving. Since we were staying at the Orleans, we decided to eat here since it seemed like the only thing open at that time.

The graveyard specials are pretty sweet deals. Although the food is less than spectacular. It's just "eh..ok." It was more of just to satisfy our hunger at such a late hour. The service was a little slow. Even at 1:30 AM!

We came back for brunch the day we left and the place was packed! Everyone else had the same idea. I ordered their egg and ham special and it was just like any other egg and ham dish. Nothing special about it except the price. My brother ordered the chicken fried steak and he did not like it. It wasn't crunchy like other's he's tried. And it was on the soggy side. No good! But since it was cheap, we got what we paid for!

At least the Keno girl walks around and is helpful. That was the highlight of the restaurant. Even if I lost 5 bucks.

I've been coming here ever since I was a kid! From late night hunger pains to free comp coupons from my mommma. Either way, service and food has always been excellent! The servers are helpful and knowledgeable about the menus. I recommend this place!

Ordered ruben sandwich, and was not very good (kinduv mistery meat, very tough), with oily fries that were not that good either.  Service was poor.  I would avoid.  This is what happens when you don't use Yelp before you try a restaurant!!!

I thought, the cafe would be worth a try. Started off ok, my date and I got seated immediately, got drinks right away, ordered in a decent amount of time. Then the appetizer (onion rings) came out along with my chicken noodle soup. The onion rings were good, not overly oily, good crunch, good taste, and a big dish of ranch, I was happy. Chicken noodle soup was not as good. The noodles were soggy, chicken was dry, and overall had very little flavor. Entrees came very quick, we had barely gotten the onion rings.

My fish and chips were very oily, there was oil dripping on the plate, the fish was bland, although the fries were decent. My dates turkey burger was also fairly dry and flavorless. Needless to say we did not finish the meal. 

Overall it was a little under decent, would definitely think twice before going again.

I've eaten here many times, and enjoyed the chicken pesto sandwich, chicken salad sandwich, and wonton soup. Today was no good. My boyfriend ordered the plain waffle and sent it back after I tasted it and agreed that it was mushy inside. My bf ordered a bowl of chicken noodle soup instead, which is usually a safe choice. Nope! The broth was pretty good, but the noodles were cooked to the point of disintegrating and it was a big bowl of mush. 

To top it off, we had the longest wait ever, for everything from the food, to being checked on by the server, to getting the check. We were there for at least an hour.
The food here is great..... Check out the Players Choice 24 special! The prime rib is so worth the money, it's always juicy and its a nice cut. It comes with a side salad and some dinner rolls.

I guess when you're starving anything will taste awesome. 

I ordered the graveyard special "pancake sandwich" for $5.99 which was supposed to be a sandwich made out of pancakes, ham and eggs in the middle but I requested it to be separated, which the waiter was kind enough to do. The waiter was attentive and made sure my glass was full. I'm only giving this place three stars because there are definitely better places in Vegas for graveyard specials.

I have a friend who loves this place.  She always finds something in her wheelhouse.  This time, it was the oxtail soup.  She wanted it as soon as she saw it on the menu, and she consumed it like Meg Ryan ate that sandwich at Katz's in When Harry Met Sally.  What the rest of us had: prime rib and baked potato (both bad, 1 star).  A hot sandwich with fries (both good, 3 stars).  A burger (dry with a bad texture, 2 stars).   The service is fine, but seems a bit slow at times, though the servers are moving all the time.  Without the oxtail soup, I'd give it a 2.  With the oxtail soup, I'll score it a 3.  If you visit, hopefully you'll find something you like.

Three stars for this. My wife ordered the Won Ton Soup but didn't like it. I had chicken parm which was good, kids had a huge burger and Chinese chicken salad, these three items were good. The service was really average. If need be we would eat here again.

the Courtyard Cafe at the ORLEANS, is my go to place for some good comfort food. i recommend the REUBEN .........  it is my fav and the Cobb salad or Cobb wrap is another good choice. depending on what time u visit ........ a lot of locals eat here. the service has always been fine, but sometimes the CC is very crowded. i like the CC and will continue to dine there while at the ORLEANS.

I would maybe go here if I were comped tickets. The clam chowder was watery, the turkey wrap tasted like it had been sitting in a fridge for three days.  And the service was mediocre. This is the kind of restaurant that you go to if someone else is buying because it's certainly not worth your money. Don't waste your time at this dump.

Noo don't go is all I have to say. We used to come a lot  from 2013 to the beginning of last year. We just came back today expecting everything to be amazing and the  same. And it was so bad. I got one of my favorites, the chicken caprese sandwich and I regretted it. It was so dry, I had to ask for more vinaigrette to make it
Edible. I was so disappointed.  And to top it they upped everything a dollar or two.
oxtail soup wit bae, was bomb, it was so tender, and juicy, i can't believe this was such a hole in the wall place no one knew about! and the best thing about it... it was 24 hours!!!!!

Call me cheap but I'm not used to steak and eggs that go over $5 during graveyard hours.

Here, it's $6.99, but I had hope that maybe the quality was better than other graveyard steak & eggs places. Unfortunately, I was mistakened.

The portions are larger than others by a fraction but all in all, the virtually the same except you pay $3 more. Scrambled eggs were cooked surprisingly well. And lastly, some crappy potatoes. The hash browns tasted like papers. Oh, and they add a random slice of melon with your dish.

Overall, not too impressed. I'd rather go to South Point where I'd get the same for better(somewhat). Nothing fancy here unless you're starving.

The Courtyard Cafe is your typical diner with generous portions. The food itself is not great, but it serves its purpose, and that is to satisfy your hunger. The prices are, expectantly, lower for a comparable establishment on the Strip, and if you have enough points accumulated in your B-Connected account, you can pay with your points. 

The fried stuff, like the fried clams, onion rings, and french fries - actually, the french fries are darn good here, are good, but for health reasons, I try to stay away from fried foods, especially sides. 

I've had the Turkey and Avocado wrap. The turkey was of the deli meat variety, and did have a sufficient amount of avocado. It was a nice sized wrap, but it did lack flavor. I ordered potato salad on the side, and, and that, too, I found bland. I had a taste of the Oriental Chicken Salad, and it was on the sweet side - it was okay, but the flavor just didn't mesh. I've also had their chicken Caesar salad and while I'm kind of grateful that the dressing wasn't too rich, it was actually not rich enough, especially for a Caesar dressing - and the chicken was bland. The fried cheese thing that topped the salad was good though. 

I've eaten breakfast there also, and I'm not much of a breakfast eater, so that was your typical sausage and eggs with coffee at a reasonable price - kudos for that.

BBQ burger was delicious!  I was there with a large party and had a chance to see how their menu items were plated.  Everything was huge!  I heard nothing buy compliments from others that what they had ordered was good. They were also able to split our check however we wanted so it was easier to check out.  They had the sheets of paper at the tables to play keno, an attendant came over to us.  The multiple TV's in the dining area allowed us to see if we won.  I would recommend this cafe to anyone staying at the Orleans.

by far the worst prime rib ever!
 this place should be ashamed of themselves. prime rib should have a nice helping layer of pepper seasonings crusting the outside of it and slow cooked to perfection. this was seasoned with peter shaker from the table and tossed in a super high oven cooked for 2 hours. i had better at a freaking foo truck. if you love prime rib don't get it here.

Good place for a meal while at the Casino playing. I drove across town to try the prime rib. I was looking for a great meal at a great price. The meal was average for the price. Friend had a BBQ hamburger that looked great. Mostly sandwiches and cafe food there at a reasonable price.

HORRIBLE customer service here. I recommended this place to 2 of my friends tonight.  I got the wrong steak not once but TWICE. MEDIUM RARE isn't that hard to cook. The manager tries to charge me for a house salad after I get my steak entree wrong twice!! The entree comes with a salad!! NEVER would recommend this place in a million years. Absolutely last resort restaurant right here.

Didn't actually eat here. Waited 15 minutes and still no wait staff came so we bailed and had an awesome meal down the hall at the buffet for probably even cheaper! (Breakfast at the buffet is less than $10!)

Been here several times since the casino's ownership change. Service here has suffered along with menu selection. They nixed the Chinese menu altogether. Also, servers are not as friendly or expedient.
24 hour open cafe with a good variety of breakfast items, salads and meals..came here for early, I think 1:00 am for breakfast...good pancakes, eggs and toast...good service and fast

My alternative to 3.95 graveyard specials @ the South Point. Often less crowded then that south point's cafe but the quality of the steak is a few steps better and the location is much closer then compared to the south point.

There are down sides. Service isnt exactly the greatest. some times there'll be a line of 6 to 8 people waiting to be seated and there's a bunch of tables available but seating was being strictly regulated which was very strange. Other times you'll be seated almost immediately with food coming out less then 10 minutes after ordering.

overall the service is a small price to pay for steak and eggs after midnight.

I stayed at the Orleans for 6 days during the Viva Las Vegas convention earlier this month. This is my go to place for a good meal that isn't from the greasy food court. The wait was never bad, especially considering that there were events going on all day and night. 
My favorite item here is the Cobb Salad. The portion is good enough to fill you up for the majority of the day. Breakfast is pretty good,  I really like the omelettes. Their turkey burgers are pretty good. 
The only thing that was a little of sometimes was the service. 
My friend had a pajama breakfast here with about 20 people. Our server seemed a little unhappy and rude. Another server took forever to get my turkey burger out, and it was a hamburger. I don't eat beef, so he had to send it back. By the time it came out,  everyone was done eating. The other times the server was great and quickly got our food out and brought everything we asked for.

Great service by Jesse... really great.

Had the crab cake benedict, but it wasn't like Tower Cafe (Sacramento, CA) used to make. I think the ham may be too much, or just too salty. Crab was pretty darn fried, which adds the wrong flavor for my preference.

Nice, big restaurant and very convenient if you're staying at The Orleans Hotel (not recommended).

At 3 am it was OK ..I guess u can't go wrong with $6.99 for steak and eggs right? I wanted something nicer but we didn't find anything :'( that was open :'( plus my pal had to get to school in a few hrs :-/

Fast and friendly service, best value in the hotel and food is tasty. A win-win. Next to The Prime Rib Loft that charges double the cost, I suspect the only difference is a higher cost there and more ambiance. It depends on the experience you are looking for, but overall I give this place a thumbs up, and I am a fussy. Good job!

Everything is great tasting when i's 4 am,  you're hangry, and looking to sober up. Courtyard Café is 24 hours so this restaurant inside the Orleans Hotel doesn't close. I sure hope they wash the pots and vacuum the carpet. 

The graveyard menu is homely with some Hawaiian dishes. I saw loco moco but veered away from that greasy stuff and went with the infamous oxtail soup. The oxtail soup is 4.5 stars. It's beef style soup with ample tender oxtail, celery, carrots, bok choy, and peanuts. Yup, peanuts. It's served with a side of rice and grated ginger. I wished they used a some sticky rice. Long grain rice can get dry. Otherwise, the soup was delicious. 

Like most hotel restaurants, the service was hella slow. At 4 am, everything is that much slower and your party is quiet and impatient since they're damn hangry. Don't expect a sense of urgency from the service here.

Gross. Gross, gross, gross. 
Not my choice to dine here. The food is super greasy, inauthentic, and unpleasant. Even the fruit cup had stupid fruit- you know, the kind that's not ripe and isn't varied. 

There are so many amazing restaurants in Vegas, and not all of them are expensive. If you're using yelp, please, go find a better spot for breakfast.

I eat here for one reason, and one reason only. 

$4.49 STEAK & EGGS !!!!!!!!!!!!

It used to only be $3.99, but the price raised the extra .50 cents a month or so ago, because they now offer this spectacular deal ONE HOUR EARLIER ! Unlike most steak and egg specials which start at midnight, this establishment now offers it at 11 pm. 

It's not the greatest thing you'll ever eat, but for a broke college student who tends to either party the night away or study the night away - this is a God send. Service is usually pretty quick [again this is late at night, I'm not sure about their peak hours]. 

I'd recommend ordering the steak one level under what you would usually order. For example, if you like Medium, order it Medium-Rare. The cooks usually over cook the steak. One time, a group of us ordered steak ranging from Rare to Medium Well, and each and everyone one of our steaks was cooked to Medium. Which of course, made me happy as that's how I like my steaks, but my fellow steak and egg eaters were not too happy. 

Toast, eggs, hash browns, 1 piece of frui & steak, all for under 5 dollars. What more could one ask for?

As a general cafe in a casino this place serves the usual dishes. The service was alright and there was nothing spectacular about the food. The coffee was good and the pies were of a normal magnitude. The food was that of a cafeteria at a hospital. If you can eat elsewhere, please do.

Came here for dinner. We wanted to try their Ox Tail soup as for the soup it wasn't to bad but everything else was poor quality. I ordered the prime rib and it was very dry. My daughter had ordered the children's breakfast and when she poured the syrup on to her pancakes the lid completely came off. The entire bottle spilled all over her literally! She was drenched in syrup her shirt, pants, hair covered! We left the table and I cleaned her up as best as I could. 

We returned to the table to try and finish dinner. Although the busser was helpful and constantly asked if we where ok the server or management wasn't present. My son informed me that when we left the manager came by but when we returned she didn't say a word to my daughter. 

A sorry would have been nice. This clearly wasn't her fault she didn't spill the syrup the lid was lose and fell completely off. It was such an inconvenience for us to play clean up during dinner to not even have management check up on their guest. They offered NOTHING! They went on as if it was normal. My daughter sat there drenched in syrup trying to finish her dinner. What a way to make your guest feel better. It's not my place to ask for anything because I shouldn't have to. My daughters breakfast should have been taken care of, an apology should have been made something should have atleast been said or done but we walked away with NOTHING!
Similar food to a Denny's very cheap quality, service was atrocious and price was not that great either.
Courtyard Cafe has a large menu an a lot of cheap specials had the steak an eggs it was great , service is top notch

Located inside The Orleans, this place is great for late-night eats for cheap! It is not too far from The Strip so if you coming from there, it is a quick taxi cab ride here. What I love about this place is their "Hawaiian" Special. I always get the Oxtail Soup. It comes with a big bowl of oxtail soup with bok choy and broth that is made to perfection with a side of rice. I grew up on this dish and I know whats good oxtail soup and what's not good. I have to say that it is as good as it gets here and it is only $9.99! 

They also have a $6.99 steak and eggs special. The steak is huge and made to your liking. Ever since they had the oxtail soup special, I stopped getting this only because I guess.. its that good!? 

Service is fast and amazing. Everyone here I feel like is super friendly and they make you feel welcomed and at home. The servers talk to you and really seem to care about your time at the cafe!

Steak and Eggs!!!

Who can beat the price of their steak and eggs for late night fix? This is actually my third visit and just never yelped since I was pretty intoxicated the other two times.  Probably the only time I was not as intoxicated.  Thanks for being so efficient in filling up the water cup.  Totally needed that.  

Fast service, and great food (only for late nights).

The Courtyard Cafe at the Orleans Casino has got to be one spot that any local or tourist come to! As you all know, this city is known as a city that does not sleep, and because we do not sleep as tourists coming here for the first time, or locals who are just plain insomniacs- we come to the Courtyard Cafe to take advantage of the Graveyard Special! Yes, there is such thing! 

The special consists of the infamous $4.49 Steak & Eggs (with french fries or hashbrowns)!  Along with the steak & eggs, they provide bread and butter, which you also have the choice of what type of bread to eat!  There are also about 3 to 4 things on the graveyard menu, but this is what we all come for!  If you do decide to visit the cafe anytime before midnight, there is a 24 hour special on the double cheese burger, which you can customize to your liking (the rarity to how well-done the meat should be, the type of cheese, and you can also ask for a side of sauteed mushrooms with extra charge, but so worth it!)

If you're driving to Las Vegas up the 15 and you see the billboard advertising the steak and lobster special, don't bother unless you don't mind tough and chewy lobster and an even tougher steak. 

Also, the prices are misleading as to get the low advertised price, you have to sign up for their players club, which a lot of their wait staff were really pushing that night I stopped in. 

Service was awesome but expect the food to be the casino cafe usual. Cheap and not very good unless you happen to be drunk and need to get something into your system other than more alcohol.
Food was ok, I had loss n bagel.  Son had pancakes, they were ok.  Averaged $11 a head.  WORST service ever, really unbelievable.  Never eat there again,

If you're looking for a quick spot to eat, keep walking. We came here after checkout with our luggage prior to leaving for the airport. We were seated promptly but after that everything moved slow as molasses. Once seated our waitress did not appear for more than ten minutes. I noticed other tables getting service but my table and the one next to me couldn't get service. 

When our waitress did arrive we ordered food and drink. We waited another 25 minutes for our food to arrive. I would've never thought an order of pancakes and a half sandwich with salad would take that long; also keep in mind the restaurant wasn't even half full. 

The checkout line was also slow and their credit card machine was down. 

In the end, the food was good and that was the only thing keeping my review from a one star.

I don't normally say this for any eating establishments located anywhere on casino property but here's my two cents on this place. First of all this was a late night visit due to a sudden craving for steak and eggs so I can't say if your experience will match mine. The service was excellent they were a bit short staffed when I came in but my waiter was friendly,attentive, and amazingly fast so my hat is off to him he earned his 50%tip. Now on to the food. my steak and eggs were perfect. The steak was cooked perfectly, my eggs weren't runny, and my wife's omelet was awesome as well. She had the custom omelet with Swiss cheese,spinach and mushrooms. She's usually a picky eater and didn't come up for air once. So If your up late and want a friendly, clean and good place to eat stop by the Courtyard Cafe in the Orleans, you won't be disappointed.

Decor
This café has high ceilings and bright colors

Location
Inside the Orleans Hotel, centrally located off the casino floor.

Meals
Coffee is average but Good food. American and Asian breakfast choices

Prices:
Prices are similar to a Denny's

Bon appétit

EXCELLENT steak and eggs. yeah it's $3.99 and i see some people complaining that it used to be 1.99 but when you look at it...3.99 is still AMAZING!

The meat was awesome, not very fatty pieces (like at bill's) and the rest is your simple hash browns and eggs. =) but the meat makes all the difference.

And you have the awesome gumbo.
Just a little far from the strip =T

As hotel guests of The Orleans we opted to use our $20 dining credit at this cafe. The portions were large but the positives pretty much stop there for me. My Philly Cheesesteak wasn't especially tasty. Our waitress seemed like she was really unhappy to be working and always seemed eager to rush away from our table even though the restaurant was less than half full. In my next visit to The Orleans hotel I won't be dining at the Courtyard Cafe. There are better dining options as well as a food court.

The food was good, the prices were attractive but service stunk.

Since I was staying at the Orleans Hotel, my brothers and I decided to eat at the cafe for convenience. My brothers order the T-Bone special for 11.99  while I ordered the 5.99 Prime Rib special.

We were seated promptly but service took a skydive after that. Jose was supposed to be our waiter but he ignored us to serve the larger tables. I hate it when waiters judge you by the cover. Just because I'm in jeans and a t-shirt, it doesn't mean I don't tip well.

We sat there for 5 minutes and no one came by to greet us. Finally the busgirl came by to ask us what we wanted to drink. Drinks came after a few minutes.  After waiting another 6 minutes ( I timed this), some random person from the back said that he was going to take our order for the waiter. After we gave the waiter our orders the food came out in 20 minutes. I kid you not! 

I got frustrated and asked the busgirl who our waiter was. She told us it was the guy who has been ignoring us. "Jose". I then told her that we were not greeted at all by him. After that complaint someone else came by to take care of us. When I paid for the check, I noticed they changed the name of the waiter to the person helping us. In the end I gave our waitress 20%. 

They service good food here. It's a shame the bad service contradicts the great prices and food.

BTW the Prime Rib was awesome. Not just because of the price but because it tasted like a really good cut.

So after a long day of being at the Viva Car show, my friend and I were starving, and the damn buffet closed at 9pm! so we decided to give this place a chance. This place is 24 hours and seemed like a way better option than the lame food court. The service was very slow, it took way too long to get a glass of water, I guess they figured we didn't need water since we had our boots, lol! 

When our waiter finally came over, he told us about the graveyard specials that start after midnight, that we could just wait and get the specials if we wanted, so we did that. We ordered a sampler platter in the meantime, because we were starving and had like 30 minutes or so to wait still. 

The sampler platter was awesome! It came with chicken strips, delicious fried calamari, onion rings and hot wings. The calamari and the chicken strips were so amazing, best thing I ate while in Vegas that weekend. Then at midnight we ordered the graveyard specials. I got the $3.99 Steak and Eggs, which is a great deal, but it was whatever. My eggs were delicious, but the steak was kind of rubbery and dry, so major bummer. My friend hated her toast, said it was the most ghetto burnt toast ever, hahahaha! 

So the graveyard specials are just ok, yea it's a lot of food for the price, but I liked the sampler platter much better. Also, it's a lot of food by the time I got the breakfast special I think I had eaten way too much, and was so full. We did not need to order that much food, but it was like only 20 bucks for all of that so not bad. I would've given them 4 stars, because our waiter was very nice, but way too slow and my steak sucked, so yea there you go.

Bad service from the waiter and cashiers. 

This place used to be packed and we would have to wait in line even around midnight. But I guess the removal of their Chinese menu, salty menu items, and bad service made the locals steer away from the once, popular coffee shop. 

Our waitress took a long time to take our orders and we were pretty hungry. Then when we ordered, the food came out quick. BUT she practically lightly flopped our dishes on the table!!! My girls and I looked at each other like "WTH?" I mean, I was with my little daughters and even THEY asked what was wrong with her attitude. 

We ordered the lobster/steak special (discount applicable ONLY IF you are a member), chicken wings, and prime rib. The wings were a bit on the salty side, the salad was drenched with ranch, so there was more dressing than salad, the lobster was tiny and over cooked, but the steak was ok. BUT the prime rib wasn't good. Only the first few bites in the center were we able to swallow. Reason being, the rub they use on the outside of the meat tasted almost cured! So we had a lot of leftovers, thinking about how to fix them so we could eat it the next day.

The two cashiers were even rude when I tried joking to them about my bill. Instead of kindly saying no thank you, they gave me the "eye" and a smart -alex smirk. 

It's no wonder the entire place was practically empty! Everybody was at FRIDAYS or at the food court!

I will not be coming back here because the rude service from everyone EXCEPT the bus boy (decent job on water refills), and poor quality food.

That's too bad because I used to go here a lot with friends and family.
Overall service and food was good.   The portion are decent.  Our waiter was prompt and friendly.  Can't go wrong if your staying in Orleans.

We had breakfast here before checking out, had no complaints at all. I had the steak and eggs with potatoes. I was great, only problem was some kind of sauce on the steak. But I knew it was going to be on it, so that's my fault. Overall it was a good breakfast.

We used to come here regularly when my boyfriend and I would visit Las Vegas. Whether or not we were staying at Orleans, we made a trip out the cafe for the late graveyard specials. We actually found it by accident when we stayed at Orleans and saw long lines of late night club goers retiring the evening with a late night meal at value prices. At the time, the grave yard specials we restarting at $3.99 and up and had a good selection from breakfast food, to burgers, to the popular steak and eggs. 
This brings us to present time, though it's been months since my last visit, I've noticed the decrease in popularity and menu items and increase in prices. There no longer is "graveyard specials" but now offer a steak. Special for $13.49 and/or select appetizer items at discounted price. With competitive specials all around town, I think they should really try to entice people to want to come back.
Nice graveyard menu with meals under $5. Had a sweet waitress. If you're staying at the hotel, they give you a 10% off coupon.

This place is classic.

About a dozen years ago, kids used to come here after midnight to eat $3.99 steak and eggs. Times have changed, and I'm not sure if kids still do this, but if you're looking for some cheap/semi-delicious food, you should visit Courtyard Cafe.

Portions are huge! Don't expect anything super delicious. Just expect to get full.

We had to get breakfast near the lost and found place where I had to retrieve my lost camera, and decided on Courtyard Cafe.
The staff were great! we had the chicken fried steak was average and not crunchy according to my tough critic. Personally I never eat the stuff.  Coffee was ok.
I enjoyed the blueberry pancake stack and a couple of eggs.
The price was reasonable..
It was fun seeing the Rockabilly people all dressed up for their convention.
I think our waitress was Angelica who was good.
The main attraction here is being in a quiet quick breakfast place.

Food is OK at best. Food takes forever to come out. Do not eat here if you want good food or if you're in a hurry. I'd actually recommend going to the buffet over cafe. Same crap same price but buffet offers a bit more items.

uh Oh, gotta change my review, went last night ordered the graveyard breakfast steak and eggs, Steak was very cold, eggs was cold, hashbrowns were also luke warm; Food just wasnt hot at all from the kitchen, nor was my partners plates.  Okay , in all fairness to The Courtyard cafe, I noticed every other table around us that patrons were all ordering the exact same thing and that was the Prime Rib Dip so that must be the one good thing that they have.  In fact all of the male waiters are horrible servers , Tammi and the rest of the ladies are the best... Straight men make horrible waiters... Be afraid folks.  P.s.

We have been visiting this cafe since it opened and always get a good meal here and have had just about everything on the menu. My favorite is the chicken fajita salad  (but was surprised to see the size got a lot smaller). Meatloaf and rotisserie chicken are good choices too. Mashed potatoes are real and excellent.  The employees at this cafe are always very nice and the price is right too!
very convienent.  I'd rather eat her than the buffet in the orleans. We always go downtown and eat the Main street casino buffet or Hotel California (cafe).

Killer breakfast if you order it at breakfast time.  I can't speak for the grave-yard hours, but during the morning, this breakfast is very good.  Scrambled eggs are scrambled and not burnt.  Hashbrowns are golden.  Bacon is crispy all the way through (no chewy parts).  And the coffee is coffee.  This is the one area that is still done well in vegas.  The buffets became overpriced and bloated through the years.  But the morning breakfast is still fairly inexpensive and done well.

Clean comfortable tables. Friendly wait staff and plenty of them.  If you get seated in the further back areas, you'll feel like you're not in the casino at the moment.  This is a good thing.

The food here is good when you are in a hurry.  Prices are very reasonable.  Staff is always friendly and attentive.  The Prime rib is excellent for the price.  Sandwiches are always fresh.  Burgers are cooked to order and always good.  I do not recommend the meatloaf if you like meatloaf you will be disappointed.

I had a discount coupon as a guest in the hotel and decided to try them out for a breakfast.  My choice that morning was chicken fried steak and eggs ($8.99), a large orange juice ($3.49)and a cup of decaf.  When will I learn not to order scrambled eggs in a casino cafe, they came from a big pan of eggs.  The rest of the meal was just acceptable.  The service was sort of weird where nobody seemed to know what their job was in relation to the rest of the staff.  I wouldn't rule them out for another visit but I sure wouldn't go out of my way to go there again.

Steak and eggs.
Steak and eggs.
Steak and eggs.
Steak and eggs.

Do you hear that chant? Steak and eggs. For breakfast. Steak? For breakfast? What?!?!?

Apparently the locals love it here and they have the cheap deals for them. You can get it for $9 on a weekday. That's still an amazing price.

Too bad I came here on a weekday.

Located on the first floor of The Orleans Casino, in the back, Courtyard Cafe lets you take in the wonderful smells and scents of .... the casino and the cigarettes. It's not that bad haha. It's just a really wide and open area and there's no wall/barriers, so you can see your Keno bets if you really wanted :P
After waiting in the line for 15-20 minutes, we finally got a seat in the back (or is it front LOL) and our waiter came over to ask for our drinks. Water. Yes. Water. After that, he took a while to come back to get our orders. 


Guacamole Bacon Cheeseburger. They have a lot of guacamole in here. Since I had asked for medium rare on the patty, the patty wasn't overdone and hard. It was actually rare and you could taste the juices. The guacamole had a kick to it that I loved (it wasn't spicy per se). The bacon was overdone a little bit more than I would have liked, but it's wasn't to the point where it was burnt and not edible. That was the inside. As an overall taste, though, it was a good size for $9.99 (pretty big) but it was still average to me. I've definitely had better burgers but as my friend would say, this was decent. More than decent. I took out the onion rings because if I hadn't, my big mouth wouldn't have gulped this down. The onion rings were eaten last but they were a bit dry without any... hmm.. BBQ sauce! Or any sauce. So I guess maybe I shouldn't have taken them out? :(

You could also get a side and it was fries but definitely ask if they make substitutions! I got hash browns on the side (or potatoes I guess) and I needed ketchup with it. They were lacking saltiess if you ate them solo.

I didn't get too much of a chance to eat what present company had (I was pretty filled) but as I sat up and got away the chant returned.

Steak and eggs.
Steak and eggs.
Steak and eggs.
Steak and eggs.

Courtyard Cafe is similar to most casino eateries, where diner-like food is what's on the menu. 

Breakfast is usually the way I go... So I ordered one of their breakfast specials. My breakfast was like any other breakfast I've ever had at any other 24 hour / late-night breakfast-serving diner...

But that prime rib dip..... Ooooh.
I was so jealous when my friend's prime rib French dip arrived at our table. With an extremely generous portion of pink, juicy prime rib between two halves of a baguette, who wouldn't be jealous?! I had never really seen any restaurant be so generous with meat before. I was lucky enough to snag a few bites... AND OMG. Delicious. 
Its taste so deliciously reflected its presentation and divine looks. 

Next time I'm going with the prime rib dip!
The food here is pretty good considering it is from a cafe in a casino. I was expecting more cajun or creole style menu items though.

We went to lunch with the family who are in town an staying at the Orleans. 3 of us had the hot turkey sandwich which was great. The turkey was tender just enough an the mashed potatoes good. stuffing was ok a little bit to much sage for me but was ok. Service was good an very friendly. All In all all the food we had was great.

Had breakfast here. Diner style with a huge menu and large portions. The charge 2.50 for coffee...that's a little ridiculous. However, our breakfasts were pretty good. The italian style frittata was really good. the sauce was a bit tomato pastey, but still very good. The orleans omlette was also good though it could use some herbs or something to enhance the flavor. Still for dinner food it was pretty good.

Unlike the other reviews that I have come across, I didn't eat any of the graveyard specials.  I opted, instead, to eat a prime rib dinner here.

Although I've only eaten here one time, I enjoyed a Prime Rib, salad, baked potato in lieu of fries, plus a dessert (chocolate cake).  My friends had the Prime Rib Dip (prime rib on french roll sandwich, pickles, olives, fries, and  au jus).  We each spent approximately $13 (with tip) for our meals.  All i can say is YUMMY!

The salad was so-so.  It was basically what you'd expect for a side salad (tomato, lettuce, croutons, etc).  Nothing to write home about.

My boyfriend had the prime rib, but instead of a salad had opted for the chili, along with chocolate ice cream.  The chili was fairly ok, and chocolate ice cream is basically chocolate ice cream.  There were also some rolls that they served with our entrees, which were also pretty good.

The prime rib entrees, however, were a different story.  Each were cooked according to our specifications.  The size of the prime rib was approximately 8 oz. each.  They were definitely monster-sized portions, and we definitely didn't end up cleaning our plates.

The prime rib dips (sandwiches) were served on a seasoned french roll with garlic and butter.  Heavenly.  Not only was the meat cooked well, but the garlic and butter mixed on the bread was a perfect touch.  In addition, the fries were quite crispy (not soggy) and seasoned.  

The chocolate cake was a generous piece, but was definitely moist and delicious.  I ended up eating the entire thing by myself.

Overall, a great experience. The portions were huge and the service was pretty good.  Although I kept waiting (anxiously) in anticipation of the entree, I was definitely well pleased with my choice.  I will definitely be coming back here for another prime rib dinner/prime rib dip.  With prices like these, why not?

I've been to the Courtyard Café many times as a tourist and less as a resident.  We met friends who are staying at the orleans for dinner last night and they chose the Café.  I got the Cobb salad wrap with Cajun fries.  Wonderful!  My wife had the chicken cutlet and she liked it.  Our two friends were pleased with their meals, so it was a happy table.

For dessert, two of us got the chocolate brownie dream.  It was a good size brownie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and some whipped cream.  Perfect ending to the meal.

This place merits the 4th star for their Cajun fries alone!  That certainly kicks everything up a notch!

This is just an average 24 hour casino cafe serving all sorts of breakfast, lunch, and dinner entrees.  There is a large selection, not really much to say about it.

I ordered the fish and chips, one of my favorite comfort foods.  The order is 3 smallish peices of processed and prebattered fish (think Gorton's).  They were all very greasy, the fries were seasoned and it also came with a side salad or soup and corn on the cob.  The tartar sauce was a bit too rich and lacking any real flavor.  I was using ketchep after my first peice of fish.  The meal didn't make me sick and is edible, but if you are really craving fish and chips, it would be better to just go across the street to McMullen's.  

Service was good, the waitress really hustled and the drink server topped off my ice frequently enough.  The reason I gave only two stars however is because of a policy they have at this cafe: no take out or to go orders.  I have never heard of anything so strange and can't figure for the life of me why they would do something like that.  

I wanted to order a tuna fish sandwich to go, but I couldn't, they wouldn't allow it.  I asked what do customers do when they can't finish, well, they have boxes.  Okay, well can I order it and then request a box?  No.  Really?  WTF?!  After some more bewildered discussion, the manager said I could order it and request a box, but I HAD to eat some of the order.  CRAZY!

Anyway, the tuna salad had large chunks of dry albacore, the lemon mayonaise was good though.  The side of cole slaw that came with it was too creamy and rich and lacking any flavor.

We order room service from the Courtyard Cafe a couple times during each of our 4 day stays at The Orleans. Everything is pretty good except the eggs - I'm convinced no one in this hotel knows how to cooks non-watery eggs (see my review on the French Market Buffet). The only problem with the room service is by the time your food gets to you, it's lost a lot of it's heat. Other than those two issues, the food and service is good! They usually have some great specials going on, too!

I came to the Courtyard Cafe at the Orleans on Saturday and it was absolutely packed.  I was meeting some family here for breakfast before they headed home to California.  It was very busy on this day.  We stood on line for a while before finally being seated.  Apparently there was a big convention being held on this weekend.  Because the place was so busy it took a while for our food to come out.  We had planned on a 9:30 breakfast.  We ate closer to 10:30.  

Across the table various food items were ordered.  My aunt got California Benedict and seemed to enjoy it.  My grandma and cousin both got a scambled egg and toast.  It seemed perfectly average as a boring meal like that should be.  I ordered a Philly Cheese Steak.  It was alright.  There was a lot of cheese which I appreciate.  The meat was perhaps a bit dry for my liking but the sandwich was elevated over all by the onions, mushrooms, and bell pepper.  I especially enjoyed the mushrooms.  So many places don't serve mushrooms on their cheese steaks and I love mushrooms.  For my side I ordered potato salad.  It was fine picnic style.  Nothing remarkable.

A coupon was used at the end of the meal to order a dessert.  We got a slice of carrot cake.  This was good carrot cake too.  You could see the fresh carrots throughout.  The spice level was spot on.  There was a good helping of chopped walnuts both in the cake and on the frosting.  The frosting did not tast much like cream cheese as I like but it was fine.  The whole thing was topped with a drizzle of caramel sauce.  Oh, did I mention this was a huge slice of cake?  Three or four layers and a nice wide slice.  We all shared it it was so big.

I've had better.. but you can't beat the prices.  $3.99 for the midnight steak and eggs special is pretty much free.  $11.99 for the 14 oz prime rib or 11 oz Porterhouse is also definitely a deal.  I really liked my porterhouse but it wasn't the same as a full on steakhouse... admittedly this is probably due in part to the cheasy casino atmosphere vs. the typical steakhouse 'the room is so dark you can't see your food (or date)' atmosphere.

Small cafe, located inside the casino. My only reason for stopping was cause I had a meal voucher to redeem. 

Food was just ok, nothing to write home about. Casino food!!
But the three stars is for the server, I do not remember his name but he was the nicest server I have ever had in my whole entire life. Very very polite, very attentive and on point the whole time.  This guy needs a raise. Sorry I dont remember his name :(

We ate there several meals while staying at the Orleans for a military reunion.  Very nice menu with lots of specials for all meals, such as steak and eggs at $6.99 for the "graveyard shift"  and prime rib for $13 at normal dinner hours.    Quality was fine. Service was friendly and good-natured, if a bit slow due to heavy traffic.  Open 24/7 and very convenient as well as casual.  A good meeting/chatting place as well.

Their new location is pretty nice & clean. Had the dependable gumbo & the oxtail soup w/all the fixins. They currently have a restricted menu right now, but they had what we were craving. Seems the oxtail soup really shines more in the evening, such that the broth can keep maturing its flavors. Service great as usual.

I read the other reviews before posting & this place has been treated pretty fairly. It's better than average most of the time.

Its a casino cafe with a traditional American menu, cheap prices, good service and its open 24 hrs a day.

One of the few casinos cafes still doing graveyard specials @ $3.99 & under. 

Good steak & Eggs! 

If your out late this is the spot!

Probably the worst restaurant I've ever been to.  This outdated cafe is located in New Orleans hotel.  We came here because they're known for their $3 steak and eggs dish, four years ago...  Price went up to $6.  This is still affordable, but the food quality was just out of this world... far from being consumable.  Most people at my table got spam and eggs or steak and eggs.  I got sausage and eggs.  I passed my sausage around and everyone at the table agreed that I have the best dish and loved my sausage. lol  The spams were really salty!  There was only one server who served 10 tables and 5 hostesses to greet and seat people.... Overall, avoid this hotel.  It's filled with old and weird people and food isn't all that great to attract anyone's attention.
I ordered the prime rib and I would say it was very, very good! Perfect size, perfect temp and tasty! They lose one star from me as I found the cashiers there very rude!

@  5am, after dancing your drunk @ss off and spending bank at the bar, this is the spot for some $4 steak and eggs breakfast. I never have eaten anything else than the steak and egg breakfast, but for $4 you can not complain. It's actually better than denny's steak and eggs. They get busy, but the Hawaiian server we always had treated us well. Service was way better than I expected. Totally worth going for some steak, eggs, hash brown, toast, and everything else that goes with it. If your on a budget in Vegas this place won't make you broke.

We had a $10.00 coupon so we wanted to give this place a try! I like that this 24 hour casino cafe is more adventurous with their menu then the others in town . I've been to a few and have never seen a crab cake sandwich ($10.99 )on the menu. I automatically knew that I'd rather get that then a burger or a turkey sandwich. The crab patty was crunchy on the outside and was filled with sweet crab meat. It is served on grilled  Focaccia bread with lettuce, tomato , coleslaw and roasted tomato tarter sauce, I ordered the potato salad as my side. It was delicious!  I'd like to go back and sample from their Hawaiian menu.

Decent American food at an average price. I had an omelet at 11:30 at night and it was not half bad. Service was a little slow at first but they soon kept the drinks full for a good recovery. Disappointing thing is the graveyard specials are only Mon-Thurs and start at midnight vs. when I was in college a few years back it was at 11pm. They also serve Chinese food at night but the last time I tried it, it was total weaksauce.

Holy bejeez..wtf is up with the cheap bastard complaints about the $2.00 increase on the graveyard specials? You can't even get an effin' value meal for $3.99 at Mickey D's, let alone a big honkin' steak & eggs.

This is not the place for great service or fantastic food. You don't come here to be treated like royalty, you come here to satisfy your hunger and stretch your dollars. But obviously, they're still too expensive for some of you el cheapos out there. Whining about a measly $2.00 extra for steak! 

It's best for breakfast..that's all I had. Sandwiches tend to be dry and burgers over done. Steaks are hit or miss, but if you're paying graveyard prices..does it really matter?

My BF gambled away plenty of benjamins over the course of 3 days at the Orleans tables, so they generously (I'm being sarcastic here) comped us $90 worth of food at the Courtyard Cafe. 
Sure, it doesn't make him even Steven..but at least we got fed!

this place is inexpensive - not cheap - inexpensive.

The menu is huge!  I dont recall anything over $15.

The service is accurate, attentive and warm.

If you find yourself way off the strip and/or gambling an The Orleans give it a go.

I came here tonight with my wife and our friend before the movie. We have to say it was decently busy and I would have to that I was impressed. Our waitress and the bus lady were on point. My glass was never empty. I had the Philly, the wife had the chicken and salmon, and our friend the Loco moco. We all agreed our dishes were perfectly cooked and we doubt it say in the heat lamps past 30 secs. The resturant was clean then most we been to lately. Great work and food guys!

Sometime around 3:00 a.m., in a post bar haze, I dined here...because it was the only place open at that time in The Orleans.

I have no idea why, but I ate a cinnamon/sticky bun thing that was dipped in egg batter and pan fried like french toast.  But wait...there's more!  It was then topped with corn flakes, dry oatmeal, and almonds, and served with butter and syrup.  And I think I ate it!

They get points for creativity, but the food is definitely not gourmet.  The food is simple and the prices are not bad.  I think my sticky bun thing was around $5-6.  The staff is nice, but very busy.

This is o.k. after bar food, but I would try the other dining options at The Orleans when they are open.

Our server couldn't properly take our orders. I ordered prime rib medium-rare with mashed potatoes and gravy. I received medium prime rib with mashed potatoes and no gravy on my mashed potatoes. My mom ordered her prime rib medium-rare but received well-done prime rib. My prime rib was dry, over cooked and not tender at all, very mediocre. The only plus is that the lady who served our beverages was very nice and more attentive than our server.

1 year 9 months later, I visited this café again to see if there are any improvements compared to my last visit. Wow, I'm now begging Yelp to start implement zero star or even negative star rating because this place got even worse.

We visited the café at the peak dinner time but the place was almost empty, which was not a good sign. Anyway, we ordered different items, mostly steak and prime ribs, none were of any good. When they brought out the food, the meats color looked weird and not appealing at all. They were way overcooked and not a hint of any seasoning. They were bland, chewing, and just plain bad. For my steak, I only took a few bites because I was so hungry. I got a stomachache about 40 minutes later. 

Even though their food price is average, I considered them to be expensive for the crappy food they serve. TGI Friday charges similar price for steak but at least you get decent good tasting steak at TGI Friday.


For service, the wait staff looked so gloom and doom, no one even crack a little smile the whole time we were there. Everyone of them look so depressed, which in turn made the whole dining experience very depressing. Again, the place was pretty much empty and no one came to refill our drinks, the waitress that was serving us disappeared for a long time, so we had to wait quite a while to get our check.


Overall, I will definitely stay away from this place, even if they let me eat for free. I'm just surprised that the casino upper management let this café get this bad. SMH.
try their steak & shrimp, taste ok, service on par

This is The Orleans 24-hour cafe where you can enjoy breakfast all day along with burgers, sandwiches, Chinese food, soups, salads, low carb options, etc.  
  
I was there for breakfast last Friday morning and had their special of Two Eggs, Two Bacon, Two Sausage, Hashbrowns, and Buttered Toast for $4.95.  It's not on the menu but the waitress offered it to me when I ordered one of their French Quarter breakfasts.  The breakfast is simple with no frills, so it satisfy whatever craving you have.

My only real concern was the service.  They're in a real rush to take your order and get you out of there is how I felt.  When we weren't ready to give our order, the waitress came by and made it seem like a chore that we were taking so long.  (They weren't that busy!)  And when our orders did arrive, our check was soon to arrive too.  I hate when the waitstaff dumps your bill on your table while your meal is still hot.  I wouldn't say that the Courtyard Cafe has a whole lot of personality working here.

When you are ready to pay your bill, bring it up to the front and get it in line.  They work like machines up there too.  

I haven't had anything else there, but my friends who dine there every year are pretty satisfied with what they do offer.

I've gone here numerous times and left very satisfied. Food is good and plentiful. It is by no means an upscale bufet but honestly upscale doesn't work for me as I don't care for that kind of food. 

You will get down home foods here - ham, chicken, ribs and pork loin on the carver stations, a Mexican area with cheese enchiladas, beans, rice and taco fixings, a Asian grill area where you can decide what goes in.

Nathan even stopped to tell the manager how well it measured up to many on the strip. 

My one BIG issue is the smoking in the casino. It's horrid. Not really the cafes fault but ick. I'd definitely ask for an interior table in the restaurant as it makes a BIG difference.

We landed in Nevada from NJ and went straight to our hotel, so I was happy to find a great breakfast spot on the premises. The service was fast and friendly. I had the Orleans Omelette and a shortstack of buttermilk pancakes which were divine. It's a little pricy for breakfast, but the food was fresh and delish. Definitely satisfying.

Nightly 7 pm - 11 pm $12.11 (for B Connected card holding members only) for Steak & Lobster: 5 oz steak, 3.5 oz lobster tail, potato & green beans    http://bit.ly/UWCBvv

5-stars because:
- For all of Nov 2012 they offered that deal for $7.11, which I had for dinner on Wed/28 Nov.  But, they extended the Nov 2012 steak & lobster extra low price ($7.11 from $12.11) to include Dec 2012.  I plan on getting it again in Dec.  Remember: $7.11 offer only for B Connected card. 
- Ernesto, my server, was excellent
- Food was pretty good and definitely filling (dinner also came with 2 bread rolls)
- At $12.11 I'd rate them 4-stars but at $7.11 they're 5-stars.

Giving my honest opinion. The atmosphere is noisy, it's not the best, and definitely not the worst. I had the prime rib, prepared the way I asked medium rare. Very few fatty bits in the steak. Potatoes were old, but the service was impecable. I plan to come back and soon.

My family went in around 3am and it was the only thing open besides Fuddruckers and Subway.  In the past when we came before all of these foodcourt business, we got steaks and whatevers.

$3.99 steak and eggs!  Comes with hash browns and toast.

I admit, my medium done steak was kinda hard to cut and chew.  Meh.

Then they charged all of our drinks regardless of what it was with $2 somethings.  Total bill for 3 dishes and 3 drinks was $21.

Good stop for breakfast. Reasonably priced as long as you don't change the way it us on the menu (subbing fruit or English muffin add $1.50) good choice selection and pretty quick service. UPDATE- I ordered a mushroom omelette abs was given SAUSAGE!! I don't eat pork !! Very upsetting. But accidents happen. Wish our server would have written our order down rather than trying to do it from memory.

I came here for breakfast on a Thursday morning trying to get in an out quick for cheap... It's the most important meal of the day don't cha' know!!!

I ordered: French Quarter Breakfast Served with buttered toast, potatoes, Two Eggs Any style  and sausage for $7.49 (photo attached)

When I booked this hotel I was told that I got a free breakfast... Didn't mention where in the hotel, but this place seemed like the logical answer. As I ordered my food I mentioned this and the waitress said she would look into it. By the time she told me I was at the wrong place to receive this discount, I had already started eating!

The food was good, hot and quick, but not free or even cheap. After coffee and OJ, the total was about $14 with tip... Not cheap by any meals, especially because I was told it would be free!

I would probably come back because its convenient, but I would ask about the discount before you sit down if you get the same deal that I did.

low-priced meals on casino level floors....the inners of the orleans....serving variety 'n' all...standard american o' chinese...an odd mix at that.....pricing mostly $five and $thirteen being on the high side.....portions large 'n' fairly quick servicin'.....efficient in refillin' or replacing without askin'.....eating a hearty meatloaf, eggs and hashbrown....double fisting two diet cokes at all times...quickly replaced when one near empty.....meals acceptable and decent...for drink and large meal under $ten spent......a casual solo meal before work to begin.....pass on the keno for a later time.....

While I was not thrilled with my Loco Moco gravy, the Cafe service was good, and my buddy really liked his experience. His salad was crisp and cold and he raved about it. I did like the open 24 hours aspect.

This place is "okay."   Ate here for breakfast and was disappointed that my food was just slightly warm.  

I had a special called "The Deuces Wild"  for breakfast that included: 2 pancakes, eggs, hash browns, 2 pieces of bacon, and 2 links of sausage that was barely warm.  It tasted like it came from the nearby "French Market Buffet."  

I believe that my food came from warming trays and was not cooked fresh.  

The price is right for this place though!

Real Shxt, after hours your pretty much here for steak n eggs. Across the board every spot with discounted steggs is on point (props to all the chefs of course), but real shxt, we come here just for the service. TAD IS FVKCING AWESOME. EVERYTIME we come here, he takes our order without having the need to write it down and delivers!!! Wifey's preggo but he always makes sure it comes out well done! Seriously! Customer service from tad is "A frickken PLUS PLUS!" TTAADDDD!!!!


ASK FOR TAD DAMMIT!!'

Not very impressed with this cafe. My grandparents visit this cafe often and wanted to take me and my family out to dinner here after we had spent the day with them. I got the jumbo friend shrimp meal and was not impressed with it at all. Considering it was about $16, I expected it to be a little bit better quality than most cafe food. I was wrong. It tasted like freezer food that was bought from a grocery store and reheated for me to eat. The fries that came with it were soggy and less than appetizing. I didn't even try the vegetables because of how disappointing the rest of the meal was. The service was good and the waitress was quick, especially for a table of six, but the food was a deal breaker. 

I am saddened by the lack of quality and high price of the food and I do not plan on returning to this location.

Can I give it -5 stars? BEWARE! I ordered steak and eggs for the late night special. I took a few bites out of my steak, at first thinking it tastes strange, maybe just not the highest quality. My wife tasted it and spit it out, saying it was "rancid". I was very nervous that I might get food poisoning. 

The hostess was nice, not charging us, and they got security involved to take a statement in the event that I got sick. It was disappointing that they never called me the next day to check to see how I was feeling, but that goes with the territory, I guess.

Mistakes happen I guess, but the waitress said , "The steaks are marinated because they are of lesser quality". I've had great steaks (Canal Street), steaks that were in the freezer for awhile (with lesser taste), and even cheaper quality steaks but nothing tasted like this. Late night steak specials at other restaurants, (Ellis Island, etc) cost about the same, and are MUCH MUCH better.

At best the steak was spoiled, at worse, I don't want to speculate. It's ironic that the Orleans has the best steak restaurant in town (Canal Street) and the worst as well.

Mom and I had dinner here recently as everything else was packed solid.  We had to wait a few minutes for a table but it was not too long.  The drinks server came over right away and took our drinks order.  Our waiter came over after that and took our order.

I had the Chicken Fajita Salad with Lettuce, onions, bell peppers, corn & black bean relish, tomatoes, cilantro, cheddar & Jack cheeses (I had them hold this), tossed with chipotle ranch dressing & topped with avocado & fire grilled, marinated fajita chicken strips. The salad was really tasty.  Lots of good toppings, grilled chicken.  Dressing was a bit spicy.  

Mom had the BBQ Burger - All beef patty, topped with cheddar cheese, bacon & onion strings, smothered in bbq sauce.  The burger was cooked well.  Good sauce on top.  Onion rings instead of strings but overall tasty.

This is a good coffee shop when you want a lot of options with basic food, good food though.  I am sure we will be back as we gamble at the Orleans often.

Not too bad. But why does the Keno start at 900am? Had breakfast here and waited an extra 15 mins to check the Keno #'s after we were already done eating breakfast. That's our own fault though.

If you restaurant has so-so coffee (especially at a 24-hour joint like this)...you don't deserve 4 stars plus. 

Ordered the spam, eggs and rice...nice!!! Can't go wrong with that. Mac salad was a bit bland. Service good and the lines went fast. And btw..I won back my $4 from Keno when I hit 3 numbers! LOL!

After a couple hours of post-midnight bowling, our group was pretty hungry and came here for some late-night eats! We all ordered the $7.99 8 oz. Sirloin steak that came with 2 eggs (any style), hash browns, and toast. A great steal!

One thing that I wished I had done was ordered it as "rare" instead of "medium rare." My steak was a bit tough than normal. My friend's "rare" steak had a more tender outcome, which was what I had wanted. But other than that, the eggs and hash browns were just as delicious.

But other than that, service is friendly.

I like many food places at the Orleans. This is not one of them. It is cheap price. But this is one of those times when you get what you pay for. It is edible, that is about it. I had breakfast and when i finished i wish i would have went to Denny's. this place food quality is below Denny's. Service was slow. Food was terrible. I would not return. There are many other good fast food places in th eorleans that are better.

Awesome affordable food.  Love their steak & eggs.  They also have a bunch of great late-night specials, so it's the perfect place to go after partying on the strip.  Will definitely come back here again!

The prime rib dip is to die for...  $10.99 and worth every penny of it.  The best part, is that you can get it morning, noon or night.   I prefer the prime rib dip for breakfast with hash browns... it's about a pound of very tender prime rib on a grilled french roll with hot au jus for dipping.

Everything else seemed acceptable, with the exception of the scrambled eggs that my daughter ordered.  Looked and tasted like powdered eggs???

Don't expect a lot when dining here. Sort of a you get what you pay for kind of thing. 

Main reason why I only gave one star is because I was shamed for asking if they gave military discount. Fine if you don't but don't make me feel bad for something so simple! I had no idea asking for military discount made me look poor! Boy the stares I got from these people..smh.

If you're a Vegas native and you know how hotel cafes work, then this is one where you only come to satisfy your hunger for whatever part of the day it is. The service is standard, friendly but of course there is nothing to be wowed about or anything to expect. Designed like your typical hotel cafe, with the typical themed atmosphere from which the cafe was named after (and this place is actually designed quite nicely after its name).

Prices are what you would expect at a hotel cafe, and there is a variety of choices to have from breakfast items, sandwiches, and burgers. If you're staying at The Orleans, this would probably be your place to stop for a quick breakfast or lunch before you get on your way with the day.

For some reason, I really, really like this 24 hour cafe. I usually get naked buffalo wings with ranch and hot sauce on the side. Soooo good. Also, the onion rings are pretty awesome, too. I would stay away from the meatloaf though. Lastly, I have tried this burger they have that comes with a garlic cream cheese and it is soooo yummy. Oh yeah, the fries are not bad either. I am really, really surprised I like this place.

If you ever find yourself hungry at the Orleans, give this place a try. My only tip is don't expect much, maybe you'll be just as surprise as I was and still am.

This time, while staying as a guest of the Orleans for placing third for Scariest Costume at its Halloween Party, I selected some Chinese favorites for lunch.  Wor Won Ton Soup packed a fine broth with pork-filled wontons, shrimp, excellent mushrooms, Green Onions, and very good soup noodles.  And, while Mongolian Beef was really fiery with four hot Red Peppers modulated by al dente broccoli and Green and Red Bell Peppers, the wok-fried beef was mostly lean but a little tough.  And, Diane's Scrambled Eggs were cold and a bit runny.

Service was good.  Soy Sauce was brought to the table as requested.  And seating was comfortable.  So, overall this dining experience was pretty good, but not rave worthy.

XXX-1/2 overall!

My friend and fellow Yelper SueSue and I came here late one night with Piper. I had no idea what a disaster it would have been or we would have went somewhere else. 

It was very late so we happen to be craving breakfast and where in the neighborhood, literally passing by so we stopped. 

We all ordered the steak and eggs breakfast which sounded good at the time.

First of all the SERVICE sucks! The waiter was as excited about his job as he was to go and have his balls waxed! We will revisit this and the reasons behind it coming up.

My meal comes and my toast is burned black, I had asked when I placed my order that my toast please not be burned. Perhaps that is just one of my pet peeves, I just can't do burned toast so I always inform in advance as a courtesy to them and I.

My toast is replaced 10 minutes later, sighs. My steak was tough and rubbery, had I not had a steak knife it would have been barbarian style eating this night!

My scrambled eggs were overcooked and rubbery, the taste of that bite in my mouth was FOUL. That is another thing  I dislike is over cooked eggs, I am a cook and that is a No No on my list and a mistake that people often make while preparing eggs. So I asked the server if he would replace them for over easy instead. The server comes back later with a plate and fork to scrape the scrambled eggs off of my plate. This was one of the most awkward and weird things that I have encountered in my years of dining. As this is happening for what seemed an eternity, my friends are and I are looking at each other completely buffoon baffled.

To make a long story short, the service sucks, the food sucks and this crap house of a café is crossed off of my list!

This is by far one of the WORST breakfast meals I have had in my life! Enough said.

the only reason this place even gets one star is because the service was good. the food was horrible. burgers taste like a bad version of burgerking, the fries taste PASSABLE, the pasta overcooked, the sauce wasnt too horrible, the pasta was hard, and the meatballs were by far the worst ive ever had in my life... they were oddly mushy and tasted horrible. im guessing they were made a week ago, then frozen, then left out for a week lol.

service so poor it was almost not there! many open table sso we do not understand this. it took 5 minutes to get the menu. 10 more minutes to get water and coffee (this was 11am!). I was ready to walk out when the hostess took our order. Took another 20 minutes to get my ham steak and eggs with hash browns and toast. WIfe's order of turkey wrap came another 5 minutes later. And we were not the only ones complaining on a slow wednesday. good grief what happens on busy weekends! go there at your own risk. you have been warned!! No apologies, no eye contact, NO TIP! cannot rate 'good for' question below except good for nothing?
Prime rib sandwich is quite good. Ask for a side of horseradish since it doesn't come with it. Good sandwich with tons of meat on it.

My last experience at this place was pretty good, for a cafe. The service was pretty good and fast. I sat down and within 1 min,  I was offered a drink by the busser. The server then showed up shortly after. I was surprise of how quick everything was. I never had to wonder why my food was taking so long. My prime rib came out just the way that I had asked, before that I had a cup of this creamy chicken soup (that was just awesome, I'm gonna go back for more!).The only thing was that I had to go get my own beer at the bar out side of the restaurant because their service bar was closed. That's OK though!

i know im prolly going to get alot of WTF thoughts about givin this place 4 stars but i gots to. before i speak on the food here get a orleans club card play whatever game u want slots table games whatever while using ur club card. speak to the one of the pit bosses that are on duty and let them know that you want to grab some food at the courtyard cafe and ask if you can have this comped and majority of the time it it will. i eat here for free almost everytime im here so thats the reason for my rating im eatin for free yo!

the menu here is like a dennys u know burgers, breakfast, pasta, salads etc but does dennys have spam and eggs?!?! or moco locos?!?! im usually here late nite drunk and the moco loce or spam and eggs always hit the spot for me! ive had the steak and eggs for 3.99 and its ok but for that price peoples should not be complaining AT ALL!!! service here has been a-ok and the decor is cheesy but whatever yo enjoy the free food if u can get it
Breakfast was good. I ate the Italian frittata. Hubby had waffles. Hot chocolate was huge and rich. Coffee was so-so. Service was friendly and prompt. I'd go back.
